question: [File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Boundary condition bypass] When querying events exactly at ledger_version boundary, can race conditions cause newly committed events to be included or excluded incorrectly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Type: Key] [Lifetime violation] Can the Key type's lifetime parameters be violated during encoding/decoding, causing use-after-free or dangling pointer issues? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Borrow checker bypass] Does the self reference in encode_key properly enforce borrowing rules, or can unsafe code elsewhere cause aliasing violations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Unsafe transmutation] Could an attacker manipulate memory to cast arbitrary bytes to Key type, bypassing type safety and creating invalid key structures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [RocksDB compaction] Can RocksDB compaction of EventByVersionSchema CF cause indices to be corrupted or lost due to improper merge operators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Column family isolation] Can writes to other column families interfere with EventByVersionSchema due to RocksDB configuration issues or transaction conflicts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Snapshot consistency] When creating database snapshots, can EventByVersionSchema indices become inconsistent with EventSchema if snapshot boundaries don't align? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [CPU exhaustion] Can an attacker create EventKeys with properties that make to_bytes() extremely slow, causing DoS during event indexing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Decompression bomb] Can malicious BCS-encoded EventKey data expand to enormous size during deserialization, exhausting memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Scan attack] Can an attacker create event patterns that force full table scans of EventByVersionSchema during queries, degrading node performance? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Zero values] Does encoding handle (EventKey with zero creation_number, version=0, seq_num=0) correctly, or can this create ambiguous null keys? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Maximum values] When decoding keys with version=u64::MAX and seq_num=u64::MAX, can arithmetic operations overflow during subsequent index lookups? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Empty event streams] If an EventKey has no events (seq_num never incremented), can get_latest_sequence_number return incorrect values or panic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Single event per version] If transactions emit only 1 event, does index=0 get handled correctly in all code paths, or can off-by-one errors occur? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Schema version migration] If EventByVersionSchema structure changes in future versions, can old encoded keys be decoded with new code without data loss? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Forward compatibility] Can encoded keys from current version be decoded by future versions if EventKey structure is extended with new fields? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Backward compatibility] Does decode_key handle keys encoded by older versions of the schema, or will protocol upgrades break historical data access? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: encode_key()] [Fuzzing coverage] Has encode_key been fuzzed with malformed EventKey inputs to ensure robustness against adversarial data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Function: decode_key()] [Differential testing] Has decode_key been tested against a reference implementation to ensure encoding/decoding roundtrip is always correct? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/indexer_schemas/src/schema/event_by_version/mod.rs] [Schema: EventByVersionSchema] [Stress testing] Under high transaction load with millions of events per second, can EventByVersionSchema maintain consistency and correctness? (Medium)
